primitiveValues.formulaTemplate:
Two-factor authentication (2FA) is an added security feature that protects your account over and above just using your username and password. Even if a hacker gets access to your username and password, 2FA will prevent access to your account. Basically, it is a method of confirming a userâ€™s digital identity on their online accounts using two different authentication factors as a combination.
The process is simple after you log in to an account with your username and password, you will be asked to a enter a 6-digit code from your two-factor authentication app. This codes refreshes every 30 seconds.
The 2FA prevents unauthorized access to your account even if your password has been compromised.
